00037 {

00040         return fitness(pop->ls_array[i]);

00047 void createPopulation(ls_population **pop, const int numparents, const int num_rules, const int rule_size)
00048 {
00049     ls_population *temp_pop = (ls_population *)malloc(sizeof(ls_population));
00050 
00051     lsystem **temp_ls;
00052     /* The code is simpler if there is always an even number of parents. */
00053     if (numparents%2 == 1)
00054     {
00055         temp_pop->pop_size = numparents + numparents + 2;
00056         temp_pop->num_parents = numparents + 1;
00057     }
00058     else
00059     {
00060         temp_pop->pop_size = numparents + numparents;
00061         temp_pop->num_parents = numparents;
00062     }
00063     temp_ls = (lsystem **)malloc(sizeof(lsystem *)*temp_pop->pop_size);
00064 
00065     int i;
00066     for (i = 0; i < temp_pop->pop_size ; i++)
00067     {
00068         temp_ls[i] = create_ls(num_rules, rule_size);
00069     }
00070 
00071     temp_pop->numrules = num_rules + 1;
00072     temp_pop->ls_array = temp_ls;
00073 
00074     *pop = temp_pop;
00075 }

00119 void assignRandomValues(ls_population *pop)
00120 {
00121     initialise_prng(time(NULL));
00122     init_genrand(&prng, time(NULL));
00123 
00124     /* Note: There are (numrules - 1) rules plus one axiom.
00125        For each rule, we have to assign it a letter. */
00126     char *rulename, currentsymbol = 'A';
00127     int i;
00128 
00129     rulename = (char *)malloc((pop->numrules - 1));
00130 
00131     /* Now assign the letters (names of each rule). */
00132     i = 0;
00133     while (i < pop->numrules-1)
00134     {
00135         if ((currentsymbol != 'D') && (currentsymbol != 'F') && (currentsymbol != 'G') && (currentsymbol != 'M'))
00136         {
00137             rulename[i] = currentsymbol;
00138             i++;
00139         }
00140         currentsymbol++;
00141     }
00142 
00143     lsystem **ls = pop->ls_array;
00144     int j;
00145 
00146     /* Iterate through each L-System. */
00147     for (i = 0; i < pop->pop_size; i++)
00148     {
00149         /* Make sure the L-System knows the names of each rule. */
00150         for (j = 0; j < ls[i]->numrules; j++)
00151             ls[i]->startvar[j] = rulename[j];
00152 
00153         /* Iterate through each rule. */
00154         for (j = 0; j < ls[i]->numrules; j++)
00155             random_rule(ls[i], j);
00156 
00157         random_angle(ls[i]);
00158     }
00159     free(rulename);
00160 }

00191 void chooseUniqueParents(ls_population *pop, lsystem **p1, lsystem **p2)
00192 {
00193     double *weight = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double)*(pop->num_parents));
00194     int *pos = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*(pop->num_parents));
00195 
00196     double temp = 100;
00197     int i;
00198     for (i = 0; i < pop->num_parents - 1; i++)
00199     {
00200         temp = temp/2;
00201         weight[i] = temp;
00202         pos[i] = i;
00203     }
00204     weight[pop->num_parents - 1] = 0;
00205     pos[pop->num_parents - 1] = pop->num_parents - 1;
00206 
00207     /* Select the first parent. */
00208     double n = 100*genrand_real1(&prng);
00209     int foundOne = 0;
00210     i = 0;
00211     while ((i < pop->num_parents) && (!foundOne))
00212     {
00213         if (n > weight[i])
00214         {
00215             (*p1) = pop->ls_array[pos[i]];
00216             foundOne = 1;
00217 
00218             /* Now readjust the 'probability distribution'. We do this by
00219                shifting the remaining 'pos' numbers up by one.            */
00220             int j;
00221             for (j = i; j < pop->num_parents - 1; j++)
00222                 pos[j] = pos[j + 1];
00223 
00224             if (i == (pop->num_parents - 1))
00225                 pos[pop->num_parents - 1] = pos[pop->num_parents - 2];
00226         }
00227         i++;
00228     }
00229 
00230     /* Select the second parent. */
00231     n = 100*genrand_real1(&prng);
00232     foundOne = 0;
00233     i = 0;
00234     while (i < pop->num_parents)
00235     {
00236         if (n > weight[i])
00237         {
00238             (*p2) = pop->ls_array[pos[i]];
00239 
00240             free(weight);
00241             free(pos);
00242             return;
00243         }
00244         i++;
00245     }
00246 
00247     /* Note: We shouldn't really get here. But in case we do, just return the first two parents. */
00248     free(weight);
00249     free(pos);
00250     (*p1) = pop->ls_array[0];
00251     (*p2) = pop->ls_array[1];
00252     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR in method 'chooseUniqueParents(ls_population *, lsystem **, lsystem **)' ");
00253     fprintf(stderr, "when selecting the second parent.\n");
00254     fprintf(stderr, "We've reached a part of the code we shouldn't have\n");
00255 }

00258 void generateChildren(ls_population *pop)
00259 {
00260     /* Note: The population should be sorted FIRST. */
00261 
00262     /* The first position where the child is located in in position 'pop->num_parents' */
00263     int i;
00264     lsystem *p1, *p2;
00265     for (i = pop->num_parents; i < pop->pop_size - 1; i = i + 2)
00266     {
00267         chooseUniqueParents(pop, &p1, &p2);
00268         crossover_ls(p1, p2, pop->ls_array[i], pop->ls_array[i+1]);
00269     }
00270 }

00273 void mutateChildren(ls_population *pop)
00274 {
00275     /* Select a random child. */
00276     int i = (int)(pop->num_parents + genrand_int32(&prng)%(pop->pop_size - pop->num_parents));
00277     lsystem *randchild = pop->ls_array[i];
00278 
00279     /*  Now select a random rule. */
00280     int randrule = (int)(genrand_int32(&prng)%(pop->numrules));
00281 
00282     random_rule(randchild, randrule);
00283 
00284     random_angle(randchild);
00285 }
